comments.author: Bruce Bowman
comments.content: I made this for a potluck yesterday, and it was a big hit! Everyone loved it. Except for the onions, it was pretty quick and easy to put together, too. Be careful with the onions, as they go from not quite done to burnt in just a couple of minutes. I burned the first batch, so had to make them again, but it was worth it. -Bruce

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Agreed, it can be challenging to time the onions. I'll have to work on a method that makes them more foolproof; I've certainly burned them before as well.

comments.author: Carla @ Gluten Free Recipe Box
comments.content: I just purchased some saffron to experiment with some new dishes. This one sounds perfect.  I love the idea of the onion flavored oil. What a great way to save money on flavored oils. I often rub a skillet with garlic, but never thought about onion flavored oil. Thanks!

comments.author: Christian
comments.content: I really love Middle Eastern food, because it's generally spicy, and has a weird blend of spices and other elements. This crispy onion and lemon-sprinkled rice would surely be scooped up and devoured in my house in less than minutes probably.  Love it!
